intro: Mesostemma schugnanicum, commonly known as the Schugnan mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
